bibl.title: Letter from Bertha L. Heilbron to Philip Showalter Hench, October 15, 1943

div1.p: Heilbron comments on Hench's article, entitled "Conquerors of Yellow Fever." She informs him that he will receive a number of copies of her article on Reed.

div1.head: Letter from Bertha L. Heilbron to Philip Showalter Hench, October 15, 1943
div1.opener:
MINNESOTA HISTORICAL SOCIETY
Saint Paul
October 15, 1943
Minnesota History
ARTHUR J. LARSEN, EDITOR
BERTHA L. HEILBRON, ASSISTANT EDITOR
Lt. Col. Philip S. Hench
Station Hospital
Camp Carson, Colorado
Dear Col. Hench:
div1.p:
Your article on the “Conquerors of Yellow Fever”
has just arrived. I read it with great interest.
You have added some very significant and interesting
material to the accounts I had read previously.
Thank you very much for sending it.

We are beginning to make up separates from the
September issue of Minnesota History. I have made
arrangements with our acting superintendent, Dr.
Beeson, to send you a number of separates of the
Walter Reed article. Would you be kind enough to
send me a list of people to whom you would like to
send the article? I can then check it against my
own list in order to avoid duplication.

We greatly appreciate your interest in this
matter.
